title: eth.syncing false, eth.blockNumber 0
body:
#### System information

Geth version: `1.11.1-stable`
OS & Version: `Ubuntu 22.04`
Started With : `sudo geth --datadir /media/ubuntu/chain/data --port 30303  --syncmode "snap" --cache=4096 --http --metrics --maxpeers 30 --http.api "eth,personal,net,txpool,web3"`

#### Expected behaviour
Start of synchronization.

#### Actual behaviour
Sync does not start

#### Backtrace


```
WARN [02-21|12:54:52.730] Post-merge network, but no beacon client seen. Please launch one to follow the chain! 
```
This is geth telling you that you need a becaon client. 

See https://geth.ethereum.org/docs/getting-started/consensus-clients

I added these parameters by following the document you shared. But I still get the same warning.
`--authrpc.addr localhost --authrpc.port 8551 --authrpc.vhosts localhost --authrpc.jwtsecret /tmp/jwtsecret`

Start With : `sudo geth --datadir /media/ubuntu/chain/data --port 30303  --syncmode "snap" --cache=4096 --http --metrics --maxpeers 30 --http.api "eth,personal,net,txpool,web3" --authrpc.addr localhost --authrpc.port 8551 --authrpc.vhosts localhost --authrpc.jwtsecret /tmp/jwtsecret`

`WARN [02-21|13:22:48.231] Post-merge network, but no beacon client seen. Please launch one to follow the chain! `
The beacon client needs to be up2sync before geth starts syncing.
